data.text: Gravel Tires: What is Your Favorite?
Favorite Gravel Tires
Pathfinder Pros. Ran Gravelkings before (SS) and the Pathfinders completely outdo them in performance both on and off the pavement.
data.author: Richard J. Auchus

data.text: Depends on size. 38mm pathfinder pros. They love the sticky gravel roads from a light rain.
data.author: Dustin Herbaugh

data.text: Bigger 45’s…
data.author: Matthew Cook

data.text: Contentinal terra speeds
data.author: Andrew Huff

data.text: Pirelli Cinturato H and M
data.author: Bhagavan Rukawa

data.text:
https://www.renehersecycles.com/shop/components/tires/700c/700c-x-55-fleecer-ridge/
29″ x 2.2″ (700C x 55) Fleecer Ridge TC Tire – Rene Herse Cycles
renehersecycles.com
data.author: Chris Bussiere

data.text: same way more money but way more miles on them with more to go. Best tire I’ve owned.
data.author: Nick Little

data.text: I’ve run Rene Herse tires for a while and they’ve never let me down! These are REALLY good!
data.author: Chris Bussiere

data.text:
https://www.renehersecycles.com/shop/components/tires/700c/700cx42-hurricane-ridge-tc/
700C X 42 Hurricane Ridge TC Tire – Rene Herse Cycles
renehersecycles.com
data.author: Lance Putnam

data.text: For narrower, I love my Teravail Cannonballs at 700x42. I also run 27.5x2.4 WTB Riddlers that I’m really happy with, though when they wear out I may look at something a little less knobby for mixed terrain. The Riddlers don’t feel too sluggish on pavement, but I’m curious if something else would roll easier for rides to the trailhead.
data.author: Caleb Blatz

data.text: I have run through tons of Riddlers and went to a Rene Herse Fleecer Ridge 55. Outstanding tire with awesome longevity.
data.author: Nick Little

data.text: I 2nd the Teravail Cannonball 700x42. Awesome tire!!
data.author: Christopher Stern

data.text: Rene Herse knobbies are fantastic
data.author: Skeevi Strauss

data.text: Depends on what your routes are like. I put 1k miles on WTB Byways and really liked them. (I wouldn’t shy away from Specialized Pathfinder Pro’s either). If you ride a decent amount of tarmac either of these are fantastic. I went more “gravel” in the the spectrum with my current set with Bontrager GR2 Team Issue. Very pleased so far.
data.author: Jason Geer

data.text: Rene herse hurricane ridge followed by terrvail rutland 42 followed by gravelking sk +

data.text: Pirelli Cinturato Gravel tires are by far the best I’ve tried. They’re fast, grippy, very puncture proof and extremely durable. They will last a long time. I run a 650b tires, Gravel M 47mm in the front, Gravel H 47mm in the back.
data.author: Elon Mulder

data.text: Currently Teravail Rutlands 27.5 x 2.1” but would like to try some Rene Herse at some point….

data.text: WTB Nano up front and Specelized tracer in rear Grip up front fir llose dirt and gravel and something a bit quicker/better rolling in the rear for pavement-best of both worlds. I just did the Truckee Tahoe Gravel ride on the and they worked awesome.
